snippet: A cross-reference of donor lists and visitor logs show that of those who gave $100,000 or more, about three-quarters of them visited the White House.
abstract: Review of campaign contributions to Pres Obama since 2008 reveals that special interests have had broad access to him despite his refusal to take contributions directly from registered lobbyists; among donors who gave $100,000 or more, 75 percent were granted visits to the White House, and many arrived with lobbyist friends in tow.

byline.original: By MIKE McINTIRE and MICHAEL LUO

lead_paragraph: A cross-reference of donor lists and visitor logs show that of those who gave $100,000 or more, about three-quarters of them visited the White House.

headline.seo: White House Doors Open for Big Donors
headline.main: White House Opens Door to Big Donors, and Lobbyists Slip In
headline.print_headline: White House Welcomes Donors, And Lobbyists Slip in Door, Too
